sourceDesc.p: Researched and written by Christopher Morrison, March 2008

div.head: Summary
div.p: The United States recognized the Republic of Guinea on November 1, 1958, when President Dwight D. Eisenhower sent a letter to that effect to Prime Minster Sekou Toure.

div.head: U.S. Recognition of Guinean Independence, 1958.
div.p: The United States recognized the Republic of Guinea on November 1, 1958, when President Dwight D. Eisenhower sent a letter to that effect to Prime Minster Sekou Toure. Guinea previously had been under French sovereignty as part of French West Africa.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations and the American Embassy in Guinea, 1959.
div.p: Diplomatic relations were established on February 13, 1959, when the American Embassy at Conakry was established with Robert W. Rinden as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim.
